intro: Hermannia rehobothensis, commonly known as the Rehoboth Hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Hermannia rehobothensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats.
